repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This PR:
1. Adds type annotations because warnings give me anxiety.
2. While doing 1, I added `vim.lsp.sync.Range` to define a common range representation in `sync.lua`.
3. Created a single `handle_diagnostics` function shared by the pull/push diagnostics handlers since the code is basically identical.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -362,7 +337,7 @@ end
 --- implementation so it's simply marked @private rather than @deprecated.
 ---
 ---@param client_id integer
----@param buffer_client_map table map of buffers to active clients
+---@param buffer_client_map table<integer, table<integer, table>> map of buffers to active clients

comment_data.body: this function is quite long, please consider adding a quick hint about what this would return.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -202,14 +205,14 @@ end
 --- prev_end_range is the text range sent to the server representing the changed region.
 --- curr_end_range is the text that should be collected and sent to the server.
 --
----@param prev_lines table list of lines
----@param curr_lines table list of lines
----@param start_range table
+---@param prev_lines string[] list of lines
+---@param curr_lines string[] list of lines
+---@param start_range vim.lsp.sync.Range
+---@param firstline integer
 ---@param lastline integer
 ---@param new_lastline integer
 ---@param offset_encoding string
----@return integer|table end_line_idx and end_col_idx of range
----@return table|nil end_col_idx of range
+---@return vim.lsp.sync.Range, vim.lsp.sync.Range

comment_data.body: Based on the code it looks like this is a map from buffer number to a table of client ID to LSP client.

 ---

----@param buffer_client_map table map of buffers to active clients
+---@param buffer_client_map table<integer, table<integer, table>> map of buffers to active clients

comment_data.body: Ehhh unfortunately I don't understand what's going on well enough to write a helpful comment here...

comment_data.body: I plan to fix this by fixing the protocol module so maybe best remove this one?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@ end
 ---@param severity lsp.DiagnosticSeverity
 local function severity_lsp_to_vim(severity)
   if type(severity) == 'string' then
-    severity = protocol.DiagnosticSeverity[severity]
+    severity = protocol.DiagnosticSeverity[severity] --- @type integer

comment_data.body: To fix this we should just remove `@private` from register and replace with `@package`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,6 +111,7 @@ M[ms.client_registerCapability] = function(_, result, ctx)
   local client_id = ctx.client_id
   local client = assert(vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
 
+  --- @diagnostic disable-next-line: invisible
   client.dynamic_capabilities:register(result.registrations)

comment_data.body:
Sounds good. I did my best to avoid overlapping work with https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27399 and https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27187, which so far don't seem to conflict with this change.

Although I'm okay with removing the change, what's wrong with a rebase ;) ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@ end
 ---@param severity lsp.DiagnosticSeverity
 local function severity_lsp_to_vim(severity)
   if type(severity) == 'string' then
-    severity = protocol.DiagnosticSeverity[severity]
+    severity = protocol.DiagnosticSeverity[severity] --- @type integer

comment_data.body: Don't worry about #27187, I'll fix whatever I need to in that. Planning on fixing and merging #27399 soon.

   if type(severity) == 'string' then

comment_data.body:
> Although I'm okay with removing the change, what's wrong with a rebase ;) ?

Ah, sorry I meant this type hint will be redundant after I fix protocol.lua but LuaLS doesn't currently provide hints for unnecessary annotations.

No worries, we can just merge anyway.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@ end
 ---@param severity lsp.DiagnosticSeverity
 local function severity_lsp_to_vim(severity)
   if type(severity) == 'string' then
-    severity = protocol.DiagnosticSeverity[severity]
+    severity = protocol.DiagnosticSeverity[severity] --- @type integer

title: refactor(lsp): fix type annotations and add shared diagnostic helper
